fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48913].
  {panel}

Hi, 

We noticed that e-mail notifications about changes in a Confluence Team Calendar are still sent to team members who do not have permission to view or edit the calendar. 

*Context:* 
We are using Team Calendars to plan projects. One team will have several projects in a row and we want to use one Team Calendar for the different projects of one team. Each project is planned before it is signed off and released to the whole development team. There should be an option that enables us to not spam the whole team with changes made in the planning phase. Restricting a calendar is the obvious solution, but it doesn't work as expected.

*Steps to reproduce: *
1. All team members are watching a team space. 
2. A Team Calendar is added to this space. Some team members might even start watching the calendar directly.
3. Viewing and editing the calendar is restricted to only one team member. 

*Actual result:* Other team members are getting e-mail notifications about the changes made in the calendar even though they can't view it. 

*Expected result:* If viewing of a calendar is restricted, then the people not permitted to view the calendar should not get any e-mail notifications, even if they are watching the respective space/calendar.

It would be great, if this issue could be fixed - thank you :-)

PS: Please add a "Restrictions" component to the TEAMCAL project :-)
fields.summary: E-mail notifications sent to team members even though viewing restricted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48910].
  {panel}

The contents of the 'subCalendarId' parameter is not validated in POST requests to 'subscribetocalendar.action' and is susceptible to cross-site scripting.

Steps to Reproduce:
# Start a proxy tool such as Burp Suite.
# Log into a Confluence instance with Team Calendars installed.
# Use the proxy tool to generate a POST request to '/confluence/calendar/subscribetocalendar.action' with the following payload:
{quote}POST /confluence/calendar/subscribetocalendar.action HTTP/1.1
Host: rgallagher:1990
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.10; rv:41.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/41.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: http://rgallagher:1990/confluence/calendar/subscribetocalendar.action
Cookie: confluence-sidebar.width=285; JSESSIONID=E85F825667B40A9201910EE6FF9DF7EA; AJS.conglomerate.cookie=""
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 75

subCalendarId=<script>alert('XSS in subscribetocalendar.action')<%2fscript>{quote}
# Ensure that a valid value is sent in the 'JSESSIONID' cookie.
# Send the request from Burp Repeater, and view the output in the browser.
# The payload sent in the POST body is reflected in the HTTP response, and its JavaScript executes.

We've demonstrated the exploitability using Burp Suite because the customer who reported the vulnerability was unable to include steps to reproduce from the UI. An attacker could exploit this instance of cross-site scripting by inducing a user to click on a link which submits the malicious POST request to the victim's Confluence domain.
fields.summary: Cross-Site Scripting in subscribetocalendar.action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48904].
  {panel}

When adding recurring calendar events the system indicates an incorrect date format, even though  the date was selected via the calendar widget and the format appears to be correct. The issue does not happen when creating single-day events. 
Troubleshooting seems to indicate that the issue is associated with setting an end date. If I don't set an end date then the recurring event is added to my calendar. I tried to use that as a work-around by then editing the recurring event to add an end date, but the end date option is apparently disabled during edit (though I don't know why that would be).

See screenshot.

This appears to be a recent bug, as I have been able to create recurring calendar events with end dates only a week or so back.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48896].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As of the last update, customers are finding their events in Team Calendar for the month of December 2016 are missing.

h3. Environment
* Team Calendar 1000.0.1 in Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
If you have calendars setup in TC with events for each month, such as Nov 2016 and Dec 2016, you will find the events for December do not display.

h3. Expected Results
Events should display

h3. Actual Results
Events don't display

h3. Notes
Events will display in another calendar app such as Outlook, for example, so we know they're in the database and not lost.

h3.Workaround
Manually refresh each time you change the month. 
* Go to the calendar menu (3-dot button near the top right) > Click "Refresh"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48893].
  {panel}

- Disable all event types except Travel. 
- Edit event, and change event type to Leave.
- Notice that now the event is DUPLICATED instead of edited. There's one for Leave and one for Travel.
- Edit original event and change event type to Event.
- Error occurs.

Edit: I see why now; the calendar isn't updated to remove the old one so I'm editing one that doesn't exist. At minimum we should have a better error message, but it would be better if this just didn't happen. Should we force the page to reload? Can we remove it dynamically?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48892].
  {panel}

h2. Problem summary
There is a conflict in jquery.ui.datepicker.js: one date picker is from AUI and the other from Team Calendars. This can cause problems in date picker pop-ups for third-party plugin functionality, such as editing page contents with the Scaffolding Plugin from ServiceRocket.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.8.18, Team Calendars 5.3.11, Scaffolding Plugin 8.4.1
# Install the above Confluence and plugins (trial licenses are fine)
# Create a Confluence space and test page
# Add a "Date Data" macro. Give it any name, and set the date format to "MM-dd-yyyy"
# Save the page
# The page should now have an "Edit Contents" option. Click this to go into the Scaffolding Editor
# Click the calendar icon into the field

h2. Expected Behavior
Date picker should pop up, allowing users to configure both date and time

h2. Actual behavior
Date picker does not pop up, or a version of the date-only picker pops up without ability to set time. Using browser's developer console, the following error can be observed:

!console.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48882].
  {panel}

When creating a JIRA issue dates event, if multiple date types are selected (ex. Due Date and Created Date), the date type does not appear on the calendar. 

If the event is modified to only include a single date type, then the type does appear in the title.

To reproduce:
* Create a "JIRA Issue Dates" event
* Select (for example) "Issue Due Date" and "Issue Created Date"
* The date type doesn't appear in the event titles
* Edit the event and un-select "Issue Created Date"
* The text "(Due Date)" now appears at the end of the issue title

This is a big problem for us because we utilize several custom date fields in our issues, we cannot distinguish between the date types on the calendar without looking at the issue details.

I attached screenshots of how a particular event looks when multiple dates are selected and when a single date is selected.
fields.summary: Date type does not appear in event title when multiple issue dates are selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48879].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to replicate
# Load My Calendars (/calendar/mycalendar.action) in Confluence.
# Open the Developer tools and use [this script|https://gist.github.com/tbassetto/1647754] to fill your browser's LocalStorage.
# Click Add Event, fill out the details, then click OK.

h3. Expected results
The event is added to Team Calendars successfully.

h3. Actual results
The "Add Event" dialog remains up, the "OK" button changes to "Adding", and nothing else happens. The event is never added. In the Javascript console the following error appears:

bq. Uncaught QuotaExceededError: Failed to execute 'setItem' on 'Storage': Setting the value of 'confluence.<username>.team-calendars.last-selected-calendar' exceeded the quota.

h3. Workaround
Clear your browser's LocalStorage.
fields.summary: Team Calendars fails to create events if LocalStorage is full

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48870].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Team Calendars only imports .ics files that respects the [RFC-2445|https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2445.txt]. However, the Team Calendars plugin expects that the *end date* exists for every event, which is not actually mandatory according to the mentioned RFC:
{quote}
   2.  A calendar entry with a "DTSTART" property but no "DTEND"
       property does not take up any time. It is intended to represent
       an event that is associated with a given calendar date and time
       of day, such as an anniversary. Since the event does not take up
       any time, it MUST NOT be used to record busy time no matter what
       the value for the "TRANSP" property.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a Team Calendars in your Confluence
# Import a Calendar using the *ConfluenceTeamCalendars_webcal.ics* file attached to this report.

h3. Expected Results
* The Calendars is imported as expected.

h3. Actual Results
* The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file and the Calendar is not imported:
{noformat}
2016-10-24 15:30:05,210 ERROR [ajp-nio-8001-exec-6] [extra.calendar3.xwork.ImportSubCalendarAction] execute Unable to import events of type other
 -- referer: http://quicksilver/confluence/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /confluence/plugins/calendar/importsubcalendar.action | traceId: cfae990fa67f73ba | userName: admin | action: importsubcalendar
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultActiveObjectsServiceWrapper.createEventEntity(DefaultActiveObjectsServiceWrapper.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultActiveObjectsServiceWrapper.createEventEntity(DefaultActiveObjectsServiceWrapper.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractCalendarDataStore.setSubCalendarContent(AbstractCalendarDataStore.java:1114)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.AbstractPeopleHandlingSubCalendarDataStore.setSubCalendarContent(AbstractPeopleHandlingSubCalendarDataStore.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.SanboxSubCalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.setSubCalendarContent(SanboxSubCalendarDataStoreCachingDecorator.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.calendarstore.DelegatingCalendarDataStore.setSubCalendarContent(DelegatingCalendarDataStore.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.setSubCalendarContent(DefaultCalendarManager.java:1808)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:302)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:190)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.spring.interceptor.plugin.ExportableInterceptorAdapter$WrappedMethodInvocation.proceed(ExportableInterceptorAdapter.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.spring.interceptor.spi.SpringInterceptorAdapter$SpringMethodInvocationAdapter.proceed(SpringInterceptorAdapter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.spring.interceptor.spi.SpringInterceptorAdapter.invoke(SpringInterceptorAdapter.java:23)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1098.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy287.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.spring.interceptor.plugin.ExportableInterceptorAdapter.invoke(ExportableInterceptorAdapter.java:26)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1103.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* The code for *DefaultActiveObjectsServiceWrapper.java:93* is:
{code:java}
Date endDate = endDateProperty.getDate();
{code}

h3.Workaround
* Remove the events that do not have DTEND defined, or add a DTEND line for the events in those .ics file.

fields.summary: EventCalendarODTest#testReminderEvent failing in Cloud Acceptance Testing build
OnDemand: No Users Found in "Who" Field
Too much space between the + and the left side of the button

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48856].
  {panel}

h6. Problem Definition
It has been noticed that loading a particular Calendar on Team Calendars plugin results the poor performance should this calendar has a large number of Events e.g. it took more 50 seconds to load a particular calendar with more than 1000 events on it. 

h6. Suggested Solution
One of the suggested solution is to improve the handling of past events (either by adding a feature to remove it in bulk or archived it) as per requested in the following feature requests:
- [TEAMCAL-886|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-886].
- [TEAMCAL-269|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-269].
fields.summary: Performance Issue on Team Calendars with Large Number of Events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48855].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# In Confluence 5.5.3 create a space.
# Create a page inside of this space, with a Team calendars macro that has at least one event.
# Export the space.
# In a brand new Confluence 5.5.3 import this space.
# You'll see that the events will not show up there.
fields.summary: Space export doesn't bring Team calendars events.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48854].
  {panel}

*Steps To Replicate*
# Navigate to "Calendars" menu from the dashboard
# Ensure there are only 10 Calendars added in the system
# Click 'Add Event'
# Click on 'Calendar' dropdown box to see the data arranged alphabetically
!^cal1.png!
# Now add 1 more new Calendar
# Repeat step 3 and 4 to see the data is now ordered randomly
!^cal2.png!

_*Note: The same issue happens to page with Team Calendar macro. The only different is that the issue happens when there are more than 10 new/existing calendars added in the page.*_
fields.summary: Calendar Dropdown Is Not Ordered Alphabetically If There Are More Than 10 Calendar Entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48849].
  {panel}

Preconditions
* There are only one Calendar A on My Calendar screen

Steps
* Disable all event types of calendar A
* Click on Add Event

Actual
* It shows edit calendar dialog

Expected
* It shows Create event dialog with an info message and allow user add custom event types
fields.summary: Click on Add event button => it shows edit calendar dialog when this calendar has not any event types

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48847].
  {panel}

# Setup Confluence with license 5000 users
# Setup TC with license 500 users
# Go to my Team Calendar then add a new calendar

Actual 
* It shows the add new calendar popup

Expected
* It should not show Add calendar button in this case
fields.summary: Users are able to add a new calendar event if TC license is invalid one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48843].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new calendar.
# Create an event that has at least a *JIRA* as Event Type.
# Now try to find the Subscribe option.
# You'll see that you won't be able to see such option.
fields.summary: Subscribe option not available when you have an event from JIRA

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48842].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Click "add calendar"
* Click "Add existing calendar"

The loading spinner is misplaced (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Loading spinner is misplaced

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48841].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce :
*Pre-requisite*
*Create application link before proceeding with the steps below*
# Login to JIRA
# Create an Agile Scrum project
# Create an issue in the newly create project
# Create a Sprint
# Drag the newly created issue to the new Sprint

# Now login to Confluence
# Create a new Calendar
# Create a "JIRA Issue Dates"
# Select the newly created project that was created in JIRA
# Ensure that Sprints checkbox is checked then click OK to finish the event creation process like the screenshot below 
!teamCalendarJIRA.jpg|thumbnail!
# Click on the Sprint that is showing on the Team Calendar and hover over to "View Sprint" like the screenshot below :
!teamCalendarJIRA2.jpg|thumbnail!
Note that it is pointing to the URL with 8080 port which is the Application URL. When it should be pointing to the Display URL as configured below :
!teamCalendarJIRA3.jpg|thumbnail!

Expected behavior : It should point to the display URL

Current behavior : it is pointing towards the Application URL which is wrong.

Below is the application used and it's version to replicate this issue :
JIRA 6.1.7
Confluence 5.6.5
Team Calendar 5.1.21
fields.summary: JIRA Sprint links is using Application URL instead of Display URL

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When adding a new event, I can't use date picker to select start and end date.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.7
 * Team Calendars 5.3.14

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new event
 # Click on the starting date to bring up the date picker.
 # Select a date to populate the field with the selected date.

h3. Expected Results

The selected date gets populated in the field
h3. Actual Results

The date picker remains popped up and no update is made on that field.
h3. Notes

The date picker works with Confluence 5.9.X and Team Calendars 5.3.14.
I rolled the add-on back to 5.3.11 and found I was able to use the date picker succuessfully.
h3. Workaround
 * Input the date manually
 * Rollback to Team Calendars 5.3.11
 ** Uninstall Team Calendars 5.3.14
 ** Download Team Calendars [5.3.11|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/version/2260]
 ** Install Team Calendars 5.3.11 via [file upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload]

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48836].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-3712

Even when the time zone is properly configured to that of the user's, the event in the series of events can't be deleted. This applies across all calendars in our instance. They appear to delete at the time of the action, but refreshing the page shows that the events is still there. There are no errors in the front or the back end, even with DEBUG logging for Team Calendars.
 

h3.Workaround To Temporarily Correct Issue*
# Log in Confluence
# Go to Team Calendars
# Select "Week" from the tabs to make the events easier to read
# Click on the event you are trying to delete and drag the event to an earlier time (e.g 30 minutes before)
# Try to delete the event we just moved
# You will likely get an error. You can ignore this error for now. 
# Refresh the page and the event will be automatically moved back to it's original spot
# You should now be able to delete any of your calendars and events.

Note: This is not a permanent workaround and the issue has been seen to re-surface after a few days. We recommend to upgrade Team Calendars to 5.3.11 for a permanent fix.
fields.summary: Can't delete event in Calendar from series of events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48834].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Confluence disabled users that subscribed to a calendar still receive notifications when calendar have new events added or when events in the subscribed calendar are modified. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user in Confluence
# Make the new user watch a calendar in Team Calendar 
# Disabled the newly created user
# Modified or add a new event into the watched calendar 

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should acknowledge that a disabled users watched a calendar but won't process the notification as the users are disabled and therefore should not receive any updates/notification from Confluence as well as Team Calendar.

h3. Actual Results

Confluence process the notification and publish notification to disabled users.

h3. Workaround

Administrator could try to update all disabled users e-mail address to another e-mail address. This way, disabled users won't receive the notification from Team Calendar in their e-mail address. Please execute this SQL query:

{code:SQL}
UPDATE cwd_user SET email_address = '<enter email address>' WHERE active = 'F';
UPDATE cwd_user SET lower_email_address = '<enter email address all in lower case>' WHERE active = 'F';{code}
fields.summary: Disabled Users Receive Notification from Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48832].
  {panel}

One of our calendars, which isn't embedded in any page, has been sending email notifications to users who are not watching the calendar. Not all users are affected. There appears to be no way to unsubscribe them from receiving these notifications.

* The users' lists of watched items doesn't contain this calendar
* When the users access the Calendars page and select this calendar's drop down menu from the elipsis, they find that they are not watching this calendar (status reads "Watch" and not "Stop Watching" or "Watched")

I used this query to see if the calendar is embedded anywhere returned no results:

embeddedSubCalendarId:CALENDARID

This seems to be a known issue, as reported here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-3709

Is there any fix for this? 

*Workaround*:

# Manually access an URL for Calendars that are tied to the user profile: {code}https://instanceurl/wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action{code}
# The user will be able to see a list of Calendars, including the ones that the same should not be watching.
# Search for the Calendar and finally, click on *Unwatch*. 

The user should no longer receive notifications from this Calendar after doing that.
fields.summary: Users receive email notifications for calendars they don't watch

The calendar actually shows the current month.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48812].
  {panel}

h6. Summary
As of now Confluence Team Calendars plugin will show warning messages should a user subscribed to a restricted calendar (they've subscribed to it before hand) saying that the user doesn't have permission to load the calendar. 

However, this warning messages will be shown for every _Event Types_ available in that particular calendar, causing confusion to the user. 

\\
h6. Environment
Tested on:
- Team Calendars plugin version 5.3.9.
- Confluence version 5.8.15.

\\
h6. Steps to Reproduce
# User A subscribe to a Calendar that belongs to User B.
# User B then restrict this Calendar to himself.
# User A would then see duplicates warning messages as per shown in the attached screenshot (_ObservedBehaviour.png_).

\\
h6. Expected Results
No duplicate warning messages would be shown in _My Calendars_ page for each restricted Calendar that the user subscribed to.

\\
h6. Actual Results
 Duplicate warning messages (based on how many _Events Type_ are there in that particular calendar) are shown in _My Calendars_ page. Please refer to the attached screenshot (_ObservedBehaviour.png_).
fields.summary: Duplicate Warnings Should User Subscribes to Restricted Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48801].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you create a new project the project in JIRA it will not be able to be added to an existing Team calendar under the *JIRA Project Releases* event type option

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud version {{5.9.1-OD-2015.45.2-0001}}
* Team Calendar version {{5.3.8-D20151021T015515}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a team calendar {{https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/<SPACE_ID>/calendars}}
# [Add Calendar | https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/create-add-and-edit-calendars-654213559.html]
# Go to JIRA and create a new Project as [described here | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/create-a-project-735940417.html]
# Go back to calendar
# Add event *JIRA Project Releases*

h3. Expected Results
Under Project Field the newly Created Project will be a selectable option

h3. Actual Results
The new project is not available
 
h3. Notes
Looks like a syncing issue with cach management, as it Requires manual cache flush to sync the new project with the calendar

h3.Workaround
*You Must Be logged in as a System-Administrator* to access the Cache management So Cloud users must file Support Request at https://support.atlassian.com to apply the workaround (Please reference this case in your request):
- Go to:
-- Confluence Administration
-- Cache Management:
--- {{https://<Instance_Name>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/cache/showStatistics.action#
- Select *Flush All*
~30 second wait no down time is required and New Projects are now available
fields.summary: Unable to Add Jira Project Release event for projects created after Calendar Subscription

h3.Workaround
# Change *End Repeat* to *Never*, and save.
# In Calendar, browse to event on the first day it should have ended, select *Delete > All Future Instances*
fields.summary: Invalid date specified error when adding End Repeat date
Event Types should support Cyrillic characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48787].
  {panel}

Steps
# Open Team calendars in 2 browser tabs
# Delete an JIRA event type at tab1
# Edit an JIRA issues that's belong to the deleted event type
# Observe behind of the edit popup

Actual result:
* It shows Exception message
!Screen Shot 2015-04-03 at 4.09.29 PM.png|thumbnail!

Expected:
* It should show the more friendly error message
fields.summary: NPE when edit a non existing JIRA event
Fix dead lock in RecurrenceRuleProcessor
Team Calendars add event button is not a button any more

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48783].
  {panel}

This search should return any items:

resolvedBy != "" and status was not in (resolved)

As an item that has never been resolved should not have a resolver. However, linked issues such as "relates to" and "clones" that have been resolved are populating this attribute.

This was noticed when the search: resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() 

began returning extra items the given users had not actually touched. This can inflate and give inaccurate figures which need to be rooted out by hand or filtered with something more like: 

resolvedBy in (user1, user2, user3) and sprint in openSprints() and assignee was in (user1, user2, user3)

But this is also inaccurate as a true resolver does not necessarily posses the item when resolving.
fields.summary: resolvedBy is populating from linked issues
Update timezone alias for ical4j to be same as team calendars timezone alias

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48778].
  {panel}

Steps:
# Import a calendar from an ics file
# Leave Name field blank (this is a required field)
# Select a valid ics file
# Click on Import button

Actual
* It show the original calendar name

Expected
* It does not make sense because Name field is a required field but it allows we leave it blank
fields.summary: Import calendar shows the original calendar name instead of blank
Calendar without viewing restrictions is not visible to anonymous users.

Hello, I have confluence server 5.4.1 (standalone) with team-calendars plugin 5.2.16 downloaded from marketplace and uploaded to confluence via file upload, but I still have problem
Linux tt2 3.8.0-44-generic #66~precise1-Ubuntu

# Create a calendar in Team Calendars, and add a large number of events (8500 events)
# Load the calendar, and while the calendar is loading the huge amount of events, reload the page midway (before the calendar is loaded completely)

  {panel}

View calendar in Week mode
# Create an event from 14:10 to 14:30
# Drag that event to other place (different time)
# Click on that event
=> It shows the new time
# Edit that event
=> It shows the old time (before moving)

!Screen Shot 2014-12-09 at 2.17.57 PM.png|thumbnail!

!Screen Shot 2014-12-09 at 2.18.05 PM.png|thumbnail!

Expected
* It should show the new time

Workaround
* Refresh the page / calendar
=> It shows the new time
fields.summary: Event Edit dialog does not update the new Start time
Multiple duplicate reminders for single Release event in JIRA calendar
Embedded Calendar deletes with space deletion

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48763].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
The events are *not* updated in application subscription e.g. Google Calendar and iOS Calendar when changes are made in Confluence Team Calendar. This includes all types including recurring events.

h3. ***Expected Behaviour***
The events are updated in application subscription e.g. Google Calendar and iOS Calendar to reflect new changes.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Create a Team Calendar
# Add events (any type)
# *Subscribe* to Calendar
# Subscribe to Calendar using URL (Google Calendar or iOS Calendar) 
# *Edit* event (Any form of edit, i.e change event name or date)
# Observe that the event is not updated in the subscribed Calendar. 

***Note:*(!) Even after 24 hours ([TEAMCAL-458|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-458]). No errors in the logs. This has yet to be tested on Outlook Calendar.
fields.summary: Calendar application subscription to the Team Calendar is not updated to new changes
Unable to move issues or versions on Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48754].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently there is a hard limit of 200 events in Team Calendars for the number of events that can be displayed in a single view at any time. However, the error message is set to show if there are more than 200 total events in the current view, the view before, and the view after, combined. For example, if you have the month of November pulled up with less than 200 events, but all events in October, November, and December equal more than 200, the error will display.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add less than 200 events for a month, but make sure to add enough events for the month before and the month after to go over the 200 limit when combined.

h3. Expected Results
The limit error should only show if the month/week/etc. the user is looking at exceeds 200.
 
h3.Workaround
None currently

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Insert Team Calendar macro into table header row, and it will not display.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.1
* Team Calendars 5.2.16

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Confluence page with table
# In header row insert team calendar gadget

h3. Expected Results
In a regular table row it will display properly:
!Screen Shot 2015-08-28 at 10.34.56.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
If it is inserted in header row, does not display:
!Screen Shot 2015-08-28 at 10.41.55.jpg|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48743].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

My customer recently built an app link between JIRA and Confluence.
It's working well so far but we still have issues when adding JIRA Events. Whenever it's using JIRA's filters or JQL it's OK (for JIRA issue date it's working using Filters or JQL).
My problem is, whenever it has to fetch a project list, it appears to be empty! JIRA Issue dates from project is answering "No project found", using JIRA Agile sprint dates and project versions are not working as well since the project dropdown is empty!
When using JQL, I can use the autocompletion on "project" keyword...
Also, I configured the application link according to Atlassian documentation (especially about the URL Patterns).

Any clues on why it's failing?
Thanks team!

Cheers,
Micky
